Key Match Events: Brennan Johnson scored his seventh goal in as many games for club and country
Logi Tomasson came off the bench to score and spark Iceland's comeback
Danny Ward was credited with Iceland's equaliser through an own goal
Pre-Game Insights: Craig Bellamy's decision to recall Danny Ward backfired
Bellamy also left himself open to scrutiny with his decision to take off Johnson at the interval
Bellamy claimed it was a'really pleasing performance, but also a learning experience'
Post-Match Reflections: Bellamy praised his team's performance but acknowledged it was a learning experience
Bellamy stated that his team will benefit from the match, even though they let a two-goal lead slip
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on a freezing night in Reykjavik
Iceland's performance was unrecognisable after the interval
Wales coasted into a two-goal lead in the first half
Others: Brennan Johnson will miss Monday's meeting with Montenegro in Cardiff due to a booking
Craig Bellamy became the first Wales manager to remain unbeaten through his first three competitive matches
